message.entry: Compute camera intrinsics options along with extrinsics from the same set of images.
Use pre-computed camera intrinsics parameters loaded from workspace.
Click to load camera intrinsics objects from the workspace.
The number of radial distortion coefficients is determined by\ntheir initial value specified under Optimization Options
Specify initial values for camera intrinsics and radial distortion coefficients.
To begin, click the Add Images button. Add from file or acquire from camera a minimum of two calibration pattern images. For best results, load or acquire between 10 and 20 images.
To begin, click the Add Images button. Load a minimum of two pairs of stereo images of a calibration pattern. For best results, load between 10 and 20 pairs.
Camera intrinsics: ''{0}'' and ''{1}'' have been loaded from the workspace.
Camera intrinsics: ''{0}'' and ''{1}'' have been loaded from the saved session.
No calibration patterns were detected in the images.
{0} images were removed because they contained points\nfor which the homography could not be computed.
Square size must be a numeric value greater than zero.
All images must have the same size.
No variables of class ''{0}'' or ''{1}'' exist in workspace.
No valid Camera intrinsics have been selected.
The same intrinsics have been selected for both cameras.
The number of images for each camera must be the same.
Stereo images folders cannot be the same.
''{0}'' is not a valid {1} session MAT file. \nPlease use the Camera Calibrator App to load it.
''{0}'' is not a valid {1} session MAT file. \nPlease use the Stereo Camera Calibrator App to load it.
Unable to rectify the stereo images. This may indicate a problem with the calibration. Try re-calibrating using more images, or try setting the number of radial distortion coefficients to 2.
Variables loaded from workspace in saved session could not be found in current workspace.

Total images processed:
Added images:
Partially detected patterns:
Rejected images:

Total stereo pairs processed:
Added stereo pairs:

Rejected stereo pairs:

Rejected stereo pairs:
Skipped duplicates:
Would you like to remove selected images and recalibrate?
Workspace does not contain valid variables.
The exported camera parameters and the estimation error must have different variable names.
The selected file does not exist.
The selected file is not a valid M-File.
The selected file's path is not valid.
The pattern detector cannot have the same name as that of the available patterns. Choose a different value for the "Name" property of the detector.
Multiple files of the same name are found on the path. Choose a unique name.
The pattern detector class cannot be abstract. The pattern detector class should implement all the abstract methods and properties in the parent vision.calibration.PatternDetector class.
The pattern detector must be a subclass of vision.calibration.PatternDetector
Error occurred while loading pattern detector at
This detector has been removed from the list of calibration patterns.
Error while invoking the "propertiesPanel" method in the detector class.
Missing natively supported pattern in Pattern Selection dropdown list.
Click the info button to learn how to create a detector to use with a custom pattern
Click Import Pattern Detector to import a class that contains a detector for your custom pattern. When you import the class, it will appear as a choice in the Choose Pattern drop-down menu.
Choose the calibration pattern in the captured images.
Import a custom calibration pattern detector.
Non-empty imagePoints returned while imagesUsed does not indicate any successful detections.
The folder specified to save images is invalid. Please specify a valid folder.
You do not have write permissions to the folder specified to save the acquired images. Please specify a writable folder.
Unable to connect to selected camera ''{0}''. Please ensure that it is not used by another application.
MATLAB Support Package for Webcams has not been installed. Use Support Package Installer to download and install the USB Webcams Support Package.
USB Webcams Support Package not installed.
Select a writable folder to save images
Specify initial intrinsics as a 3-by-3 matrix\nof the form [fx 0 0; s fy 0; cx cy 1]:
Specify initial radial distortion\nas a 2- or 3-element vector:
The initial intrinsics value is invalid.
The initial radial distortion value is invalid.
Optionally specify initial "guess" for extrinsics,\nif you know the camera's focal length and pixel size.\nTry this if calibration fails, especially for severe lens distortion.
Optionally specify initial "guess" for radial distortion,\nif the distortion is severe.
To calibrate, add at least 2 images. For better calibration\nresults add between 10 and 20 images.
Use the standard model for representing camera parameters.
Use a fisheye model for representing wide angle camera parameters.
Control model specific options to improve parameter estimation.
Set initial values of camera parameters if already known.
Scale the virtual fisheye camera field of view by varying the focal length scale factor between 0.001 and 5.
Use fourth degree polynomial to estimate the\nradial distortion of a lens.
This setting is recommended only for wide field of view cameras.\nUse sixth degree polynomial to estimate the radial distortion of a lens.
Add more images to the current calibration session.
Assume that X-axis and Y-axis are not perpendicular. This means that the image pixels\nare not rectangular. Most modern cameras do not exhibit this issue.
Tangential distortion occurs when the lens' principal\naxis is not perpendicular to the camera sensor.
Restore default layout of the app's figures and image browser.
You must compute calibration parameters\nbefore exporting the calibration data.
Export camera parameters to the MATLAB workspace.
Learn how to use this app.
Cannot change camera when images have been acquired.
Cannot change resolution when images have been acquired.
Cannot change properties when in an active session.
Choose capture interval between image acquisition.
Choose number of images to capture.
Specify image save location on disk.
Specify image save location on disk.
To start capture, specify a writable location to save images.
Accept images and close Image Capture Tab.
Select to estimate alignment between the sensor and image plane.
Click again to show the original image captured by the camera.
Using the calibration data, show the image\nafter compensating for the lens distortion.
Show the original stereo images captured by the cameras.
Visualize re-projection errors using a scatter plot.
Visualize calibration errors using a bar graph of\nper-image average re-projection errors

Show camera centric view. This visualization is most useful if you captured\nthe calibration images while moving the pattern around a stationary camera.\nPay particular attention to outliers, which you may choose to remove.

Show pattern centric view. This visualization is most useful if you captured\nthe calibration images while moving the camera around a stationary pattern.\nPay particular attention to outliers, which you may choose to remove.
Size of the checkerboard square in world units.
World units in which the checkerboard size is measured.

Lower the value to detect keypoints in images that might be blurry. Increase the value for high quality points. When the image is noisy or highly textured, increase the value to reduce the number of false corner detections.
Distance between circles' centers in circles grid in world units.
World units in which the center-to-center distance is measured.

Number of circles along the
dimension that contains the
same number of circles in
each row (or in each column).

Total number of circles in the
dimension that contains an
unequal number of circles in
adjacent columns (or rows).
Number of circles in each row.
Number of circles in each column.
Learn about asymmetric circle grid patterns and dimensions.
Color of the circles in the captured images.
Center distance must be a numeric value greater than zero.
Number of rows and Number of columns must be integer values greater than zero.
Pattern dimensions must be integer values greater than zero.
Unable to auto-populate ChArUco board properties
{0} Ensure the entire ChArUco board is captured with the camera facing directly towards the board.
Select image with a full ChArUco board to automatically populate values:
Browse for template ChArUco board image.
Number of rows and columns in the board when origin is on the top-left.
Minimum ArUco marker ID in the board.
Color of the checker to the left of board origin.
Size of the checker in world units.
World units in which the sizes are measured.
Size of the ArUco marker in world units.
{0} Ensure the entire AprilGrid is captured with the camera facing directly towards the board.
Select image with a full AprilGrid to automatically populate values:
Number of rows and columns in the board when origin is on the bottom-left.
Minimum AprilTag ID in the board.
Number of border bits in the AprilTags.
Size of the AprilTags in world units.
Spacing between consecutive AprilTags in world units.
Unable to identify tag family based on the detected tags.
